FlashFX API: Headers

Send comments on this topic.
These headers are the standard files that OEMs need to use when building FlashFX projects, or FlashFX aware applications. With the exception of ffxconf.h, all are located in the \flashfx\include directory.

Summary

ffxconf.h   The master FlashFX project configuration header.
flashfx.h   The master FlashFX header file for code which is built inside the standard FlashFX build process.
flashfx_wince.h   The master FlashFX header file for code which is built outside the standard FlashFX build process, but uses FlashFX functionality.
fxfmlapi.h   The master FlashFX header file for describing the public interface to the FML.
fxloaderapi.h   The master FlashFX header file for describing the public interface to the FlashFX Loader.
oesl.h   The master FlashFX Tera header file for a given operating system.
vbfconf.h   The master FlashFX header file for configuring the VBF allocator.

ffxconf.h

The master FlashFX project configuration header. This header file resides in each FlashFX Project Directory.

When a new FlashFX project is created, a template ffxconf.h file is copied from the \flashfx\os\wince\newproj directory.

Note that the default template header may be different for each the various operating systems which FlashFX supports, so mixing copies from different operating system abstractions is not recommended.

flashfx.h

The master FlashFX header file for code which is built inside the standard FlashFX build process. All FlashFX code normally includes this header first, immediately following any OS specific headers, and preceding any other FlashFX or DCL headers.

If custom code is placed in the FlashFX Project Directory to be built by the FlashFX build process, it must include this header first.

flashfx_wince.h

The master FlashFX header file for code which is built outside the standard FlashFX build process, but uses FlashFX functionality.

If this header is used independently by code which is calling FlashFX functionality, but is built outside the Datalight standard build process, this header is typically included first, before any other Datalight headers, and after any OS specific headers.

To use this, the \flashfx\include directory should be in the include search path.

This header automatically includes dcl_wince.h.

fxfmlapi.h

The master FlashFX header file for describing the public interface to the FML.

To use this header in an externally built application, the \flashfx\include directory should be in the include search path, and the app should first include flashfx_wince.h.

fxloaderapi.h

The master FlashFX header file for describing the public interface to the FlashFX Loader.

To use this header in an externally built application, the \flashfx\include directory should be in the include search path, and the app should first include flashfx_wince.h.

Note -- Don't confuse the FlashFX Loader with the Datalight Loader implemented in DCL. The Datalight Loader is designed to provide a simple way to read a file off a file off a FAT or Reliance formatted disk, such as what might be needed if the OS image was stored on a formatted disk. The FlashFX Loader provides low level flash access routines, such as what are typically used within bootloaders.

oesl.h

The master FlashFX Tera header file for a given operating system. This header contains default configuration values for the specific OS. This file is not normally changed by an OEM, except in cases where the RTOS Porting Kit is being used to create a FlashFX implementation for a new OS.

vbfconf.h

The master FlashFX header file for configuring the VBF allocator.

Most FlashFX projects do not need to modify the default settings in this header. The default version of this file resides in the \flashfx\include directory. To make project specific changes, copy the file into your Project Directory and make the changes there. Be sure to do a "clean" build after making changes to vbfconf.h.
